chapter.title: How to use docbook
chapter.para: You write docbook in a markup language, much like HTML. This file is designed to show you how to use the docbook format. Look at /documentation/web/docs/development/4.0-drafts/docbook to see the XML source code.

listitem.simpara: Unordered lists, like the <ul> lists in HTML
You can reference commands like grid-cert-request and files like hostcert.pem. You should use those instead of <code>
Ordered lists, like the <ol> lists in HTML

note.simpara: If your important point is very important, you might make it a note

important.simpara: If your important point is very important, you might make it important

warning.simpara: If your warning is very important, you might make it a warning

caution.simpara: If your caution is very important, you might make it a caution

tip.simpara: If your tip is important, you might make it a tip

section.title: Subsection
section.para: Subsections will be automatically indexed at the top of the chapter

section.title: Another section
section.para: You can store info in a table:
Tables are listed in the table-of-contents automatically.
You may create links to external web documents with ulink: to globus
You may create links to other sections with xref: . Also works for tables like .
If you want to control the name of the link, use link: to section1.
Print out screen contents using screen instead of pre:
section.screen: $GLOBUS_LOCATION/bin/openssl x509 -hash -noout < ca_certificate unknown option /etc/grid-security.old/certificates/bf51156a.0 usage: x509 args -inform arg - input format - default PEM (one of DER, NET or PEM) -outform arg - output format - default PEM (one of DER, NET or PEM)
